intro: Erigeron katiae, commonly known as the Katia's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron katiae is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments with minimal water.
